summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing updates on the Jeffrey Epstein probate case. It summarizes recent developments including the Virgin Islands Attorney General's intervention, liens on estate assets, and demands for a victim compensation program. It also references a forwarded news article detailing the dispute between Epstein's estate and the Virgin Islands AG.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as wanting to schedule a Webex meeting to discuss planning litigation with the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.role: Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands
persons.context: Brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged his lawyers were part of his fraud, placed liens on his islands, and made specific demands for a victim compensation program.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Claimed that liens against the estate have prevented the release of money for a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reported to have been asked to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of the probate case; his estate, will, and alleged crimes are the central topics of discussion.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of the referenced Guardian article about the dispute between Epstein's estate and the Virgin Islands AG.

connections.description: Both named as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will.
Indyke was Epstein's lawyer and named executor of his will.
Kahn was Epstein's lawyer and named executor of his will.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate in probate proceedings.
George has alleged Indyke was part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name him as a co-defendant.
George has alleged Kahn was part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name him as a co-defendant.
Feinberg was reportedly asked to oversee a victim compensation program for Epstein's accusers.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG files charges against Epstein estate
events.description: Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud. She also placed claims on Epstein's two islands.

events.title: Probate court denies Virgin Islands AG's motion to intervene
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein probate proceedings.

events.title: Estate executors seek emergency relief
events.description: The executors of Epstein's estate moved the probate court for emergency relief to gain full access to the estate's frozen funds to pay administrative expenses without the Virgin Islands AG's prior approval.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein dies by suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein arrested on federal charges
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein pleads guilty to Florida state charge
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has placed liens on Jeffrey Epstein's estate assets, freezing bank accounts and demanding approval over all expenditures.
George alleges that Epstein's lawyers and estate executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name them as co-defendants.
George has made specific demands for a victim compensation program, including waiving NDAs for Epstein's former employees and prohibiting third-party releases for participants.
Epstein's estate is valued at approximately $570 million, but the executors claim they cannot access funds for a victim compensation fund due to the AG's liens.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the US Virgin Islands, naming Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn as executors.
